alert.note: Alert for Allamakee; Chickasaw; Clayton; Fayette; Floyd; Howard; Mitchell; Winneshiek (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 22 at 3:04AM CST until January 23 at 3:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Quick-hitting round of snow tonight... .A fast-moving clipper storm system moves through the region tonight. A northwest-to-southeast-oriented swath of 2 to 4 inches of snow is expected, centered along a broad line from Mankato to New Hampton to Dubuque. The snow will be moderate to even heavy at times and likely only last for about 6 to 8 hours at a given location. The snow arrives between 6 and 9 pm and should depart the region between midnight and 3 am. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Wisconsin, north central and northeast Iowa and southeast Minnesota. * WHEN...Snow rapidly moves in from the northwest between 6 pm and 9 pm and departs to the southeast between midnight and 3 am. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Allamakee; Chickasaw; Clayton; Fayette; Floyd; Howard; Mitchell; Winneshiek
